subject: Data
title: Anecdotes vs. Data: One Story Isn't Evidence
description: A quick win: understand Anecdotes vs. Data: One Story Isn't Evidence.

hook.text: Your uncle smoked for 60 years and lived to 95. Does that prove smoking is safe? Of course not.

buildup.text: Anecdotes are individual stories. Data is systematic evidence from many observations.

discovery.text: One person's experience can be an outlier â€” the rare exception that doesn't represent the pattern.

twist.text: But anecdotes are psychologically powerful. A single vivid story outweighs dry statistics in our minds.

climax.text: Data literacy means recognizing when a story is evidence and when it's just a compelling exception.

punchline.text: The plural of anecdote is not data.

quiz.question: Why can anecdotes be misleading as evidence?
options: Individual experiences can be outliers that don't represent the broader pattern
